intro: Conostylis aculeata subsp. rhipidion, commonly known as the narrow-leaved conostylis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, often pale or yellowish flowers that bloom during the cooler months. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
